intro: Styphelia psilopus, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and typically grows on the branches of hardwood trees such as oaks and hickories. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains seeds dispersed by birds. Styphelia psilopus plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of forest canopies.
